N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5024.2 - Certain terms defined

State Regulations

For the purposes of subdivision 9 of section
511
of the

Education Law and this Part: (a) terminal illness means an illness or medical condition resulting in a life
expectancy of no more than 12 months; (b) a medical condition requiring
extraordinary care or treatment means a disabling condition which is grave and
results in the member being indefinitely unable to perform (without substantial
and continuous assistance from another individual) the activities of daily
living or in being indefinitely confined to a hospital or nursing home pursuant
to a recognized program of treatment; and
(c) an activity of daily living includes, but
is not limited to, eating, toileting, transferring, bathing, dressing and
continence. Notes
